listitem.para: statistical confidence level (%) as a string or the level of significance (alpha) as a decimal value, "95%", "99%" or 0.05, 0.01 resp (see examples).

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Performs the Pearson-Hartley outlier test. It should be used for distributions with more than 30 values.

important.para: Do use ST_pearsonhartley ONLY with NORMAL distrinutions and with more than 30 values! For more than 30 values use Pearson-Hartley test ""ST_pearsonhartley()"" instead.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting: data = [.. 0.21 0.75 0.00 0.33 0.66 0.62 0.84 0.68 0.87 0.06 .. 0.56 0.66 0.72 0.19 0.54 0.23 0.23 0.21 0.88 0.65 .. 0.30 0.93 0.21 0.31 0.36 0.29 0.56 0.48 0.33 0.59 .. 1.23 1.84 0.50 0.43 0.26 0.63 .. ]; of = ST_pearsonhartley(data, "95%") // outlier-free values [of, o] = ST_pearsonhartley(data, "95%") // outlier and outlier-free values [of, o] = ST_pearsonhartley(data, 0.05) // outlier and outlier-free values
